question: In one of the hybridisation experiments, a homozygous dominant parent and a homozygous recessive parent are crossed for a trait. (Plant shows Mendelian inheritance pattern)
choices: Dominant parent trait appears in $F_1$ generation and recessive parent trait appears in $F_1$ and $F_2$ generations.
Dominant parent trait appears in $F_1$ generation and recessive parent trait appears in $F_2$ generation.
Dominant parent trait appears in $F_2$ generation and recessive parent trait appears only in $F_1$ generation
Dominant parent trait appears in both $F_1$ & $F_2$ generations, recessive parent trait appears in only $F_2$ generation.
explanation: In a Mendelian cross (TT x tt), the $F_1$ generation is all heterozygous dominant (Tt).
The $F_2$ generation (Tt x Tt) shows a phenotypic ratio of 3:1 (Dominant:Recessive).
Thus, the dominant trait appears in both generations, while the recessive trait reappears only in $F_2$.
